pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Scope of Rules
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: These rules govern procedure in the United States district courts in all suits of a civil nature arising under the Constitution, laws, or treaties of the United States.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: General Rules of Pleading
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A pleading that states a claim for relief must contain a short and plain statement of the grounds for the court's jurisdiction and a short and plain statement of the claim showing that the pleader is entitled to relief.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Defenses and Objections
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may assert the defenses of lack of subject-matter jurisdiction, lack of personal jurisdiction, improper venue, or insufficient service of process by motion.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Default
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: If a party fails to plead or otherwise defend, the other party may obtain a default judgment.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Injunctions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A preliminary injunction may be granted if the movant shows a likelihood of success on the merits, irreparable harm, favorable balance of hardships, and public interest.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Offer of Judgment
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party defending against a claim may serve an offer to allow judgment on specified terms, with potential cost consequences if the offer is rejected and the offeree obtains a less favorable judgment.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Execution
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Process to enforce a judgment for the recovery of money shall be a writ of execution, unless the court directs otherwise.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Rules by District Courts
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: District courts may regulate their practice in any way consistent with federal law, but local rules must be filed with the Judicial Conference.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Signing Pleadings
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Every pleading, written motion, and other paper must be signed by at least one attorney of record or by the party personally if unrepresented. The signature certifies that the paper is well-grounded in fact and law.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Duty to Disclose
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Parties must disclose certain information without awaiting a discovery request, including documents and witnesses that may be used to support their claims or defenses.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Depositions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may depose an adverse party or any person who has been served with a complaint. Depositions must be taken before an officer authorized to administer oaths.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Production of Documents
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may serve on any other party a request to produce documents, electronically stored information, or tangible things for inspection and copying.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Requests for Admission
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may serve on any other party a written request to admit the truth of specified facts or the genuineness of specified documents.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Summary Judgment
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may move for summary judgment, identifying each claim or defense for which summary judgment is sought. The court shall grant summary judgment if there is no genuine dispute as to any material fact.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Entry of Judgment
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Every judgment and amended judgment must be set forth on a separate document, but a jury verdict need not be set forth in a separate document.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: New Trial
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may move for a new trial, which the court may grant for any reason for which a new trial has heretofore been granted in an action at law in federal court.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Relief from a Judgment or Order
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A court may relieve a party from a final judgment or order for reasons including mistake, inadvertence, surprise, excusable neglect, newly discovered evidence, or fraud.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Stay of Proceedings to Enforce a Judgment
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: An appeal from a judgment does not stay proceedings for its enforcement unless the court orders otherwise.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Substitution of Parties
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: If a party dies and the claim is not extinguished, the court may order substitution of the proper parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Death or Substitution of Parties
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: When a party dies and the claim is not extinguished, the court may order substitution of the proper parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Capacity to Sue or Be Sued
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Every action must be prosecuted in the name of the real party in interest, except as provided by law.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Required Joinder of Parties
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A person who is subject to service of process must be joined as a party if complete relief cannot be accorded among those already parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Permissive Joinder of Parties
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Persons may join in one action as plaintiffs if they assert any right to relief jointly, severally, or in the alternative.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Interpleader
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Two or more claimants may interplead when they have or may have adverse claims against a plaintiff who holds or claims an interest in property or money.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Class Actions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Class actions may be maintained if numerosity, commonality, typicality, adequacy, and either predominance, superiority, or Rule 23(b)(1)/(2) requirements are met.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Intervention
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A nonparty may intervene as a matter of right when their interests may be affected by the outcome and representation by existing parties is inadequate.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Impartial Special Master
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may appoint a special master to hear and determine any or all matters in an action.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Failure to Make Disclosures or Cooperate in Discovery
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: If a party fails to make required disclosures or to cooperate in discovery, the court may order sanctions including striking pleadings or entering default judgment.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Right of Trial by Jury
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The right of trial by jury as declared by the Seventh Amendment to the Constitution is preserved to the parties inviolate.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Trial by Jury or by the Court
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Issues triable of right by a jury are designated by the demand for jury trial filed as provided in Rule 38(b). Issues not triable of right by a jury shall be tried by the court.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Dismissal of Actions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: An action may be dismissed on stipulation of the parties or by court order for failure to prosecute or to comply with these rules or any court order.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Subpoena
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A subpoena may command a person to attend a trial, hearing, or deposition, or to produce documents or other tangible things.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Number of Jurors
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: In a civil action in which the right to a jury trial is preserved, the trial jury shall consist of 6 to 12 members unless a different number is stipulated.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Special Verdicts and Interrogatories
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may require a jury to return a special verdict, which shall make findings on each material issue of fact separately.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Judgment as a Matter of Law
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: If a party has been fully heard on an issue and there is no legally sufficient evidentiary basis for a reasonable jury to find for that party, the court may grant judgment as a matter of law.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Instructions to the Jury
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court must inform counsel of its proposed action on the jury instructions before the jury begins deliberating.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Findings by the Court
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: In an action tried without a jury, the court must find the facts specially and state its conclusions of law separately.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Masters
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may appoint a master to hear and determine any or all matters in an action, with exceptions for certain types of cases.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Judgments
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A judgment is final when it adjudicates all the claims and the rights and liabilities of all the parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: New Trial Ordered Secured Against Error
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court at every stage of the proceeding must disregard any error or defect of the proceedings that does not affect the substantial rights of the parties.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Seizure of Person or Property
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: At the commencement of and during the course of an action, the court may order the seizure of property for preservation or security purposes.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Appointment of Receiver
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may appoint a receiver to take and preserve property in dispute and in litigation pending the suit.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Deposit of Money
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Money may be deposited with the court for safekeeping or to secure satisfaction of a judgment.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Process in Aid of Execution
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may issue all writs necessary or appropriate in aid of its jurisdiction and to effectuate its judgments.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Magistrate Judges
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A judge may designate a magistrate judge to conduct hearings and submit proposed findings of fact and recommendations for disposition.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Consent by Parties to Magistrate Judge
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The parties may consent to have a magistrate judge conduct any or all proceedings in a civil action.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Records Open to Inspection
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The clerk's office and the records of the court are open to inspection and copying during business hours.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Maintaining Records
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The clerk must maintain records of all proceedings and filings in accordance with federal regulations.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Transcripts
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Transcripts of proceedings are available upon request and payment of costs.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Applicability to Appellate Review
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: These rules apply to proceedings for review of civil actions in the courts of appeals.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Construction of Rules
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: These rules shall be construed and administered to secure the just, speedy, and inexpensive determination of every action.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Pleadings Allowed
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: There is one form of actionâ€”the civil action. The pleadings are the complaint and the answer.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Pleading Special Matters
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: In all averments of fraud or mistake, the circumstances constituting fraud or mistake must be stated with particularity.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Form of Pleadings
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Pleadings must be filed with the court and served on all parties. Each paragraph must be numbered consecutively.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Counterclaim and Cross-Claim
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A pleading may state as a counterclaim any claim that the opposing party may have against the pleader.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Third-Party Practice
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A defendant may serve a third-party complaint against a person not a party to the action who is or may be liable to the defendant.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Amended and Supplemental Pleadings
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may amend its pleading once as a matter of course within certain timeframes, otherwise by leave of court or stipulation.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Pretrial Conferences
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may hold pretrial conferences to expedite the action and encourage settlement.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Joinder of Claims
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party asserting a claim may join as many claims as it has against an opposing party.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Misjoinder and Nonjoinder of Parties
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Misjoinder of parties or causes of action is not ground for dismissal, and parties may be dropped or added by court order.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Depositions Pending Appeal
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: After an appeal is filed, the court of appeals may permit the taking of depositions to preserve testimony for possible use in the trial.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Stipulations Regarding Discovery Procedure
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Parties may stipulate to extend or limit time for discovery, but the court may not approve a stipulation that would cause delay.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Notice of Deposition
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party desiring to depose a person shall give reasonable notice to every other party to the action.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Use of Depositions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Subject to certain exceptions, a deposition previously taken may be used by any party for any purpose.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Interrogatories to Parties
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A party may serve written interrogatories on another party, which must be answered in writing under oath.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Physical and Mental Examinations
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may order a party to submit to a physical or mental examination by a qualified examiner.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Stipulations
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Parties may stipulate concerning the admission of facts or the admissibility of evidence.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Consolidation; Separate Trials
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may order a joint hearing or trial of motions or of separate cases when doing so would avoid prejudice.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Taking of Testimony
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The testimony of a witness shall be taken in open court, except as provided by these rules.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Proof of Official Record
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: An official record may be evidenced by an official publication or by a copy attested by the custodian.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Exceptions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Formal exception to a ruling or order is not necessary to preserve the right to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Selection of Juries
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Juries shall be selected at random from a fair cross-section of the community.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Declaratory Judgments
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The existence of another adequate remedy does not preclude a declaratory judgment that is otherwise appropriate.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Garnishment
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: Process to reach property of a judgment debtor in the hands of a third party may be garnishment.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Ancillary Remedies
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: The court may issue all writs necessary or appropriate in aid of its jurisdiction and to effectuate its judgments.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for writ of habeas corpus shall state the facts concerning the applicant's commitment or detention.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Writ of Mandamus or Prohibition
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for writ of mandamus or prohibition shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to the writ.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Writ of Certiorari
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for writ of certiorari shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to the writ.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Other Extraordinary Writs
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for other extraordinary writs shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to the writ.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Administrative Action
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of administrative action shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Arbitration Award
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition to confirm, vacate, or modify an arbitration award shall state the facts showing the basis for relief.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Bankruptcy Orders
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of bankruptcy orders shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Probate Orders
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of probate orders shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Tax Court Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of Tax Court decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Immigration Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of immigration decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Social Security Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of Social Security decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Veterans Affairs Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of Veterans Affairs decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Patent and Trademark Office Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of Patent and Trademark Office decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Securities and Exchange Commission Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of SEC decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Federal Trade Commission Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of FTC decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Environmental Protection Agency Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of EPA decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Occupational Safety and Health Administration Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of OSHA decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of National Labor Relations Board Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of NLRB decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Equal Employment Opportunity Commission Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of EEOC decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Department of Transportation Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of DOT decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Department of Energy Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of DOE decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Nuclear Regulatory Commission Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of NRC decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Federal Communications Commission Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of FCC decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Internal Revenue Service Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of IRS decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.

pro_se_procedural_rules.title: Petition for Review of Customs and Border Protection Decisions
pro_se_procedural_rules.description: A petition for review of CBP decisions shall state the facts showing that the applicant is entitled to review.
